title: How to Quickly Free up RAM on Your iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Press and hold the right combination of buttons.
steps.content: Press and hold the right combination of buttons. The button combination you’ll need to shut down your iPhone or iPad depends on the model. iPhone X or later: press and hold either volume button and the side button until the power slider appears. [1] X Research source iPhone 6, 7, 8, or SE (2nd-3rd generation): press and hold the side button until the power slider appears. iPhone SE (1st generation), 5, and earlier: press and hold the top button until the power slider appears. iPads without a Home button: press and hold either volume button and the top button until the power slider appears. [2] X Research source iPads with a Home button: press and hold the top button until the power slider appears. On any device, you can also go to Settings > General > Shut Down .

steps.title: Drag the power slider to the right.
steps.content: Drag the power slider to the right. Swipe the power slider with your finger to shut your device down.

steps.title: Press and hold the sleep/wake button.
steps.content: Press and hold the sleep/wake button. Depending on your model of iPhone or iPad, this will be on the side or top of your device. Press and hold the button until the Apple logo appears on your screen. Restarting will completely shut down any running apps and associated processes, which should free up your RAM.

steps.title: On an iPhone.
steps.content: On an iPhone. Avoid using this method unless your iPhone is unresponsive. It’s a little more likely to cause problems with your system than a basic restart. However, it should clear out any RAM being eaten up by active apps and processes. iPhone 8 or later: press and release the volume up button, then the volume down button, and then press and hold the side button. Let go when the Apple logo appears. [3] X Research source iPhone 7: press and hold the volume down button and the side button at the same time. Let go when the Apple logo appears. [4] X Research source iPhone models with a Home button: press and hold the top or side button and the Home button at the same time. Let go when the Apple logo appears.

steps.title: On an iPad.
steps.content: On an iPad. As with the iPhone, this method isn’t recommended unless your iPad is unresponsive. The right way to force restart your iPad depends on the model. [5] X Research source iPads without a Home button: press and release each volume button, starting with the one closest to the top button. Then, press and hold the top button until the Apple logo appears. iPads with a Home button: press and hold the top and Home buttons at the same time until the Apple logo appears.

steps.title: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone or iPad's Settings. Find and tap the icon on your home screen to open the Settings app.

steps.title: Tap General in Settings.
steps.content: Tap General in Settings. You can find this option next to on the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Accessibility in General.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility in General. In some versions of iOS, you’ll find Accessibility in the man Settings menu instead.

steps.title: Tap Assistive Touch in Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Assistive Touch in Accessibility. Assistive Touch will allow you to perform actions without using the buttons around the casing of your iPhone or iPad. [6] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021

steps.title: Slide the Assistive Touch switch to .
steps.content: Slide the Assistive Touch switch to . When this option is enabled, you'll see a gray button on your screen. You can tap this button to use Assistive Touch features.

steps.title: Go back to the General page in Settings.
steps.content: Go back to the General page in Settings. Tap the back button on the top-left corner of your screen until you see the General menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Shut Down.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Shut Down . This option is at the bottom of the General menu. You'll see the "slide to power off" screen.

steps.title: Tap the Assistive Touch icon on your screen.
steps.content: Tap the Assistive Touch icon on your screen. It looks like a gray circle icon in a square. Your options will expand.

steps.title: Press and hold down the Home button on the Assistive Touch menu.
steps.content: Press and hold down the Home button on the Assistive Touch menu. Your screen will go blank after a few seconds, and you'll return to your iPhone or iPad's home screen. Your device's RAM will have been cleared. In some versions of iOS, tap and release the Home button instead. The screen will flash, and you’ll see your iPhone or iPad’s lock screen. Enter your passcode to log back in.

steps.title: Hold down your iPhone or iPad's Sleep/Wake button.
steps.content: Hold down your iPhone or iPad's Sleep/Wake button. You can find the Sleep/Wake button at the top or on the side of your iPhone or iPad's casing. Hold it down until you see the Power Off screen.

steps.title: Release the Sleep/Wake button.
steps.content: Release the Sleep/Wake button. When you see the "slide to power off" screen, you can release the Sleep/Wake button on your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Press and hold down the Home button.
steps.content: Press and hold down the Home button. Your screen will blank a bit, and you'll return to your iPhone or iPad's home screen. Your device's RAM will have been cleared. [7] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021 The Home button is the circle button below your iPhone or iPad's screen.
